document_title: What disease is indigestion? Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Here are answers to some common questions about indigestion:
1. What to drink if you have indigestion?
For indigestion, in addition to taking all the medications prescribed by the doctor (Histamine blockers, antacids), etc., patients should supplement some of the following beneficial drinks:
Filtered water: Patients should drink 8 glasses of filtered water a day to dilute stomach acid.; Herbal teas: Chamomile tea, lavender tea, ginger tea... can help soothe the digestive system.
2. What should I do if I have indigestion?
Mild indigestion can be effectively improved through reasonable and healthy lifestyle changes, including:
Eat smaller, more frequent meals; Chew food slowly and thoroughly.; Avoid consuming foods that irritate the digestive system, such as: spicy foods, fatty foods, processed foods, carbonated drinks, caffeine, alcohol...; Quit the habit of smoking; Maintain a reasonable weight to avoid putting pressure on the abdomen.; Exercise regularly to help control weight and promote better digestion.; Stress management.; Change your medications, typically pain relievers that irritate the stomach lining.; If a patient is diagnosed with indigestion due to a specific disease, the most important thing is to treat it completely.
3. Does indigestion cause any effects?
Indigestion is common and usually not serious. However, if the condition occurs continuously and for a long time, this may be a warning sign of an underlying disease. This also affects the quality of daily life, typically feelings of discomfort and loss of appetite. Therefore, as soon as patients notice symptoms of indigestion, they should see a doctor early to receive effective treatment.
4. What to eat for easy digestion?
Food plays a very important role in the health of the digestive system. Below are some easy-to-digest foods that you should consider adding to your daily menu:
Toasted bread.; Rice.; Banana.; Applesauce.; Egg.; Sweet potato.; Chicken.; Salmon.; Pretzels.; Oatmeal.; Low-fat, low-sugar vegetables that are good for the digestive system: Green beans, broccoli, asparagus, cauliflower, green leafy vegetables, potatoes, cucumbers...
Prioritize foods that are good for the digestive system to avoid indigestion
